review: I received the Chromecast today.  Spent a lot of time setting it up between my laptop and hdtv.  I am thinking of cutting the cable so I wanted to see how good the web videos were if run on the Chromecast.  Chromecast casts the webpage on the TV OK, after you spend some time setting it up, but the videos are not sharp - not bad but not sharp.At the same time, I ordered http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004H1RHD6/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1Belkin Laptop-to-TV HDMI Cable (Supports Amazon Fire TV and other HDMI-Enabled Devices), HDMI 2.0 / 4k Compatible.  I had a hdmi cable but it did not seem to work with my new laptop so I decided to get a new hdmi cable.  So after putting in all that time getting Chromecast to work, I plugged the new hdmi cable into the laptop and into a hdmi port on the tv.  Worked instantly.  No fuss.  No struggling to set it up. No bothering with the bane of my oneline life - logins and passwords.  Sharp videos.The difference may be due to the fact that Chromecast uses the wifi, but the hdmi cable is of course wired, but the cable is half the price of the Chromecast and is so much easier to use.  And did I say the videos are sharper too.I noticed that Youtube videos were pretty clear with Chromecast if I chose to cast them through the Roku2, but that option does not appear to be commonly available using Chromecast.Just thought someone might be interested in my experience when considering options and to know that a hdmi cable is an option and cheaper too, unless of course you need or want wifi.
